messages.title: Delivering real change
messages.content: In less than a year in Government at a UK level the Liberal Democrats have: taken 50,000 low earners in Wales out of tax altogether; increased Child Tax Credits for 100,000 Welsh people; restored the link between pensions and earnings and guaranteed a minimum 2.5% pension rise this year; introduced capital gains tax by 10%; increased a new tax on bank profits worth £2.5bn a year.

messages.title: Double the value of your vote by voting for the effective opposition in the Assembly chamber. To re-elect Peter Black you need to vote 'Welsh Liberal Democrats' on the regional list ballot paper. The alternative is another Conservative AM.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Accusing Labour and Plaid Cymru of wasting millions of pounds on hopeless schemes like flying politicians across Wales and committing to invest more in services and jobs.
Criticizing Labour and Plaid Cymru for children in Wales getting a worse start than in England, promising to invest more money in schools and teachers to cut the spending gap with England.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A better NHS that delivers for YOU
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Criticizing Labour and Plaid for wasting a staggering £1 billion in the NHS, promising to cut waste and deliver shorter waiting times for patients in Wales.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Double the value of your vote by voting for the effective opposition in the Assembly chamber. To re-elect Peter Black you need to vote 'Welsh Liberal Democrats' on the regional list ballot paper. The alternative is another Conservative AM.

issues.education: Criticizing Labour and Plaid Cymru for children in Wales getting a worse start than in England, promising to invest more money in schools and teachers to cut the spending gap with England.
issues.environment: Introduced a green deal to insulate hundreds of thousands of Welsh homes, lowering fuel bills and reducing carbon emissions.
issues.governance: Introduced measures to clean up politics - are sorting out the public finances.
issues.health: Criticizing Labour and Plaid for wasting a staggering £1 billion in the NHS, promising to cut waste and deliver shorter waiting times for patients in Wales.
issues.socialWelfare: Increased Child Tax Credits for 100,000 Welsh people; restored the link between pensions and earnings and guaranteed a minimum 2.5% pension rise this year.

housing.content: Introduced a green deal to insulate hundreds of thousands of Welsh homes, lowering fuel bills and reducing carbon emissions.

images.caption: Welsh Lib Dem Councils are investing in local schools.
